     Add a letter to the row(s) of cards on the table. Each row of cards is supposed to be a portion of a valid word. 
     Challenge the previous player to name a valid word for each row. 
     Play a specialty card. 
     Draw a card. 


The first player to empty their hand wins.

Specialty cards include: 

     Wild: may be played to a row and stand for any letter.
     Back At You: reverses play order. 
     Invisible: pass for one turn, and a challenge to you from the next player goes to the previous player. 
     New Ghostword: allows a new row of cards to be played to.


—user summary

Name: Domino Rummy
Description:
A unique card game, whose cards mostly have spots like dominoes, and whose play is a bit like Rummy but still unique.

The 54-card deck consists of: 
10 Deuces
12 Treys
12 Fours
10 Fives
 2 Tens
 6 Queens of Spades
 2 Jokers

Players are dealt 4-card hands. In their turn a player: 

     Draws one or more cards from the deck or discard pile. 
     Plays one card from their hand on the table in front of them. 
     Optionally plays one or more Queens on top of other players' cards (one card per Queen), to discard both the cards. The target player may play a Joker to counter the Queen. 
     Discards a card. 


The hand ends once one player has 4 cards on the table in front of them. Each player then scores: 

     The sum of the numbers of the cards in front of them. 
     If they went out, a bonus of 5 points, plus and extra 5 points if their cards are 2-3-4-5, or an extra 10 if they are 4 of a kind. 
     The sum of the cards' values still in hand is subtracted. 


Hands are played until one player reaches at least 100 points, and the highest score wins.

Two decks can be combined for playing up to 8 players.

—user summary

Name: Seeker
Description:
A card game version of Guess Who?  Each player spreads out an identical deck of 21 faces in front of them, and draws one card from the Character Cards to show who they are. They then take turns asking each other a yes/no question about the other's drawn face, and then they turn their all cards for whom the answer is "no" face down.  The first player to guess the identity of the other player's drawn card wins.

With 2 copies, up to 4 may play together.

—user summary

Name: Spellbound: Card Game
Description:
The object of the game is to make words by adding your cards to columns of letters already on the table. Whenever a word is complete (i.e. it is not possible to add more letters to make a longer word) the player that completed the word removes the cards from the table and keeps them, scoring points. The game ends when a player has put down all their cards. All cards collected from formed words score positive points. All cards left in a player's hand at the end of the game score negative points.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Sound Hounds
Description:
Contents:

     100 Playing Cards
     Game Play Instructions


Playing Time: About 15 minutes

Draw "head" cards and match them with "tail" cards to make words. The first player to build three words with each "tail" card is the winner!

Learn as You Play

     Recognize beginning sounds and word endings
     Decode unfamiliar words
     Build phonics skills


Game includes:

     19 initial sounds
     11 initial blends
     31 word endings


—description from the back the box

Name: Word Monkeys
Description:
From publisher's website:

The game with banan-appeal. Spunky monkeys make spelling fun! This lively game has players building words and adding points as they go. An enjoyable way to boost word recognition, phonics, and addition skills.

From the back of the box:

Contents:

     100 Playing Cards
     Game Play Instructions


Playing Time: About 15 minutes

Build a word. Use as many letters as possible. Add up the points. Go bananas and build a bunch of words! The first player to reach 30 points wins. Wild Card keeps game play exciting!

Learn as You Play

     Strengthen spelling and reading skills
     Build word recognition and vocabulary
     Develop phonics skills
     Practice addition

Name: Unnützes Quizzen: Pannen & Katastrophen
Description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Pannen & Katastrophen ("Unuseful Knowledge: Glitches & Catastrophes") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about different disasters.
—user summary

"Test your useless knowledge!
How many cigars have been on board of the "Titanic"? In how many years our galaxy will collide with the neighboring galaxy Andromeda? And is it really true that in Jamaica a whole beach has been stolen?
For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."
—description from the publisher (translated)

"Teste dein unnützes Wissen!
Wie viele Zigarren gab es an Bord der "Titanic"? In wie vielen Jahren wird unsere Galaxie mit der Nachbargalaxie Andromeda kollidieren? Und wurde in Jamaika wirklich mal ein kompletter Strand gestohlen?
Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben."
—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Animal Act
Description:
Each player starts with an empty game card. Players move their pieces around the board, then draw a playing card with a word on it and follow the instructions for the place they land on. The player acts, sings, or mimes to get the other players to guess the word. If the word is guessed correctly, the player fills the appropriate spot on their game card. A player wins when their game card is filled.

—user summary

Name: Ultimate Ruler
Description:
Theme:
The year is 1560, the year a prophecy claims one ruler will defeat all others and forever hold the throne. Do you have the mastery to build your army, defeat your foes, and prove that you are destined to be the Ultimate Ruler?

Choose your actions wisely as your fate, and that of the throne, is on the line.

---
Play:
All players start with an equal quantity of soldiers. On each turn players draw one Decree card and either play or discard one Decree Card (to draw another). Some cards played modify these actions, allowing additional draws or plays.

Other Decree cards allow players to Bribe, Recruit and cause Battle between their, their opponent, and the Neutral Soldiers. Cards change in power as the game progresses, so make your choices wisely. Strategy Hand-management is key for success in this game.

A great game for on-the-go fun with rapid, card-only play that's easy to learn but hard to master. Strategy evolves as the game progresses and power shifts between you, your enemies, and neutral.

—description from the designer

Name: Nom Noms
Description:
The players represent mice that want to eat the largest quantity of food. Food cards are revealed one by one, and, after each food card, players simultaneously chose if they want to stop or continue. If two identical food cards are revealed, me mice that are still exploring lose all the points for the food.
The winner is who reaches 25 points at the end of the round.

Name: Nació Popular
Description: This game includes four variants, ranging from a rock-paper-scissors game using cards to a classic memory game. At the end of each game, a "hugs die" is thrown, and the winner gives a type of hug according to the die result.

Name: Safari Turbo
Description:
You have been chosen to participate in a car race on a hidden, magical island. The island has transformed you into a specific character with unique powers and abilities. You must use them to help you win the race.

The object of the game is to be the first player across the finish line.

There are three levels of play: 
Beginner - Playing as yourself (without a character)
Intermediate (Basic Game) - Playing with a character
Advanced - Playing with a team of characters

In a Basic Game, each player begins with a Guardian Card, a Dashboard a Turbo Card and a Character. The Guardian Card is a log of the training that you have received from the guardians of the island. The Dashboard contains a Health Meter which indicates the health of your character, a Damage Meter which indicates the condition of your vehicle and a Binoculars Meter which helps you look into the distance. The Turbo Card allows the player to take a Turbo Roll when rolling a 6. During the Turbo Roll the player is completely defenseless.

During a player's turn, they can play any of their character powers and abilities. A player then rolls the High Speed Die to move their vehicle down the road (during certain times they must roll the Low Speed Die). They collect Game Cards and Coins along the way. They must traverse difficult terrain and battle hostile animals and other players.

Each character has at least three unique powers and/or abilities. A "power" requires a player to spend tokens and are limited. An "ability" is constant throughout the entire game.

There are different areas of the board that present unique challenges, such as the quicksand, Gator Lake, Wildebeest Canyon, Rickety Bridge, Andy Straightaway-Ice Road, and finding their way out of Tarancon Volcano.

There are friendly animals which help you such as Jora-The Lion which provides you with strength which is used in battling, the cheetah which provides you with speed, the meercats which energize your binoculars and others which provide you with coins to buy items at the Trading Post.
 There are four hidden paths. The player who possesses the compass is able to find and go through these paths. Other players may steal the compass.

During certain conditions, Game Cards can be flipped. If so, the player cannot use them. To un-flip them, the player must roll a 4 and choose not to move their vehicle.

The game ends when the first player crosses the finish line. The next closest player is declared 2nd Place and so on.

There is also tournament format. A tournament is when 2 to 5 players have agreed to participate in 10 races. During tournament play, points are awarded for pole position and guardian training. The winner of the tournament is the player with the most points.

-description from designer

Name: Slasher: The Final Cut – Gratuitous Nudity Promo Card
Description:
Promo card - Gratuitous Nudity

Card type: Scene
Card text: Move slasher to victim. Take one hit.

Name: Slasher: The Final Cut – Cursed Promo Card
Description:
Promo card - Cursed

Card type: Plot twist
Card text: Redirect all cards to one target.

Name: Slasher: The Final Cut – Coincidence Promo Card
Description:
Promo card - Coincidence

Card type: Plot twist
Card text: Move victim out of room. Move slasher in.

Name: Samarkand: Routes to Riches
Description:
The 2012 edition is a compilation of the base game and Samarkand: Routes to Riches â€“ Family Connection which was released by itself at Essen 2010 and through the BGG Store.

As members of merchant families in Samarkand: Routes to Riches, the players marry into other wealthy merchant families. They expand the trading routes of these families and establish trade relationships with other families. The player who gains the most victory points with relationships and goods will be the winner at the end of the game.

Each turn, the players either marry into a merchant family or expand the trading route of a family they are already married into.

To marry into a family, the player pays the cost of the family. Only two players may marry into each family. To expand the trading route of a family, the player must be married into the family and may pay for the route with the money of the family. The goal is to meet other families not met before (gaining trade relationship markers) and to reach goods spaces first (gaining goods tokens).

When all families have established at least one trade relationship or one family has established five trade relationships, the game ends. Each player scores their goods cards with the corresponding goods markers they have acquired, the trade relationship markers they have collected, and their money.

Family expansion:
Family ties are established even tighter now. Being merchants, the players equip their sons and daughters with goods and gems and send them out to travel the trading routes. The only thing still missing is the adequate partner. Which marriage is most promising?
